shortdesc.ph: Adjusts the playout volume of a custom audio capture track locally.
Adjusts the playback volume of a custom audio capture track locally.
Adjusts the local playback volume of a custom audio track.
Adjusts the playback volume of a custom audio capture track locally.

p.codeblock: Future<void> adjustCustomAudioPlayoutVolume( {required int trackId, required int volume});
public abstract int AdjustCustomAudioPlayoutVolume(uint trackId, int volume);

section.p: After calling this method to set the local playout volume of the audio, if you want to readjust the volume, you can call this method again.
After calling this method to set the local playback volume of audio, if you want to readjust the volume, you can call this method again.
After calling this method to set the local playback volume of the audio, if you want to adjust the volume again, you can call this method again.
After calling this method to set the local playback volume of the audio, if you want to readjust the volume, you can call this method again.
section.note: Before calling this method, make sure you have already called the method to create a custom audio capture track.
Before calling this method, make sure you have already called the method to create a custom audio capture track.
Before calling this method, make sure you have already called to create a custom audio track.
Before calling this method, make sure you have already called to create a custom audio capture track.

plentry.pd: Audio track ID. Set this parameter to the custom audio track ID returned by the method.
Playout volume of the custom captured audio, ranging from [0, 100]. 0 means mute, and 100 means original volume.
Audio track ID. Set this parameter to the custom audio track ID returned by the method.
Playback volume of the custom captured audio, ranging from [0, 100]. 0 means mute, 100 means original volume.
Audio track ID. Set this parameter to the custom audio track ID returned by the method.
Playback volume of the custom audio capture. Range: [0,100]. 0 means mute, 100 means original volume.
Audio track ID. Set this parameter to the custom audio track ID returned by the method.
Playback volume of the custom captured audio, ranging from [0,100]. 0 means mute, 100 means original volume.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p:
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
